0: no free internet in the rooms for hotel guests
After booking a weekend away with my partner and requesting a king bed was annoyed when advised that we had been allocated a room with 2 king single beds
Our Room was meant to be a city view room instead we looked directly onto a dirty wall

On arrival we checked in fine and were then told our 15 year old was sharing our bed as the room only had a king size I showed the staff my booking for 2 adults 1 child and they said if we did not want her to share our bed it would be 80 a night extra for a fold away bed the staff stood firm and refused to accept that we found it unreasonable our daughter be expected to share our bed
They have very outdated decor stained carpet no views and are mediocre
We were offered a park view for £ 30 a night extra decided against it as were out and about all the time
The room had no view but that did not matter to me
the front desk employee is very nicethe rooms door is a little broken
Eventually a twin room was found on a lower floor so the front desk tried to help but a 210 for checkin experience
Room service was fine but every order they missed or forgot something forgot cutlery sauces
1: Amazing D our room did not have a view just a brick wall
I had requested a 12 MD room access
Firstly I took time to chose a newly upgraded park view room
The room was priced well compared to other 5 star hotels and I would look to re book when next in Sydney on business again
I got there in the morning and went to a meeting got a courtesy call mid morning to say my room was ready
The Deluxe Terrace Suite was as advertised
The high standard of the room
Being Platinum members we received complimentary room upgrades overlooking Hyde park and access to the executive lounge
The ambiance is good and lively but the rooms are well insulated from extraneous noise
The in room dining was an experience
2: The bathroom is huge and the bedroom lounge walk in closet is very spacious
